==Installing QNX SDP On Linux Hosts==
  * If you haven't already done so, [https://www.qnx.com/account/login.html#showcreate register] for a QNX.com account, by following the instructions provided
  * Log-in to QNX.com using your account, and visit [http://www.qnx.com/download/feature.html?programid=18773 this page] to download a copy of QNX Software Development Platform 6.4.0 (includes both QNX Neutrino, and Momentics - a customised version of [http://www.eclipse.org Eclipse]) for Linux
  * Set the Executable bit on the downloaded file ({{{qnxsdp-6.4.0-200810211530-linux.bin}}} as of writing) using {{{chmod +x qnxsdp-6.4.0-200810211530-linux.bin}}}
  * As root, or using {{{sudo}}}, run the downloaded file and follow the instructions provided, taking care to install the software to the default location of {{{/opt/qnx640}}}
  * Follow the remaining instructions and offers to install any additional software, if required
  * Once the process has completed, log-out of your desktop environment session, and log-on again
  * Follow the instructions [http://www.qnx.com/developers/articles/inst_3107_2.html here] (from the "Activating QNX SDP 6.4.0" section) to enter any license keys and activate QNX Software Development Platform - free-of-cost license keys were provided for non-commercial/hobbyist use, last time I checked

==Useful Information==
  * [Additional useful information is provided at http://www.qnx.com/developers/articles/rel_3101_16.html The QNX Neutrino/SDP 6.4.0 Release Nodes] contain a wealth of information related to using SDP, and errata to take note of
